resources.string: For transmitting clipboard contents via NFC
Sending… Tap against receiving device now!
NFC is not supported on this device. You might as well uninstall now.
NFC is available on your phone but is disabled in Settings. You need to enable it in order to send or receive anything.

NFCCopyPaste has only one feature: it transmits the contents of your clipboard to another device via NFC. ("NFC" is Near-Field Communications, the super-short-distance radio used for Android Pay and other tap-to-share technologies.)
\n\n
I wrote it after Android 10 disabled the feature, based on NFC, that lots of my favorite apps used to share data with each other. My wife and I were used to sharing ColorNote shopping lists this way, for example. I couldn\'t fix ColorNote, but I could take advantage of its use of Copy-and-Paste. Now we share lists by copying them on one device, touching the two, and pasting them on the other.
\n\n
I hope you\'ll forgive the rough look of this app. I\'ve been programming Android for 10 years but am not a UI designer. I\'m sharing this because I hope it will be useful. If it is, and people want to contribute icons or other visual improvements I\'ll include them! Thanks.
